pr_title: Add Low/High Energy notifications to idle notifier

timeline.bodyText: Wouldn't users want to be able to be notified when they run out of energy completely?
timeline.author: Nightfirecat
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -110,10 +111,36 @@ default int getPrayerThreshold()
 		return 0;
 	}
 
+	@ConfigItem(
+		keyName = "lowEnergy",
+		name = "Low Energy Notification Threshold",
+		description = "The amount of energy points remaining to send a notification at. A value of 0 will disable notification.",

replies.bodyText: I'll set this one to not trigger when the value is set to 100 then. I had it like this because I wanted it to be consistent with the other notifications, but I agree this is better.
replies.author: Cyborger1

timeline.bodyText:
These names seem very strange, since they're backwards from what they actually do. They're basically only ever checked as if (!notify) notifier.notify();
Instead, flip the values and checks for these booleans so they start as false and trigger notifications when they're true.
timeline.author: Nightfirecat

replies.bodyText: I was following the way prayers and hitpoints was implemented, but I switched them around and made the var names a bit more descriptive.
replies.author: Cyborger1
